meanings.definition: The act of officially declaring someone a saint in the Roman Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The canonizations of saints bring joy to many believers.
meanings.sent2: The pope oversaw the canonizations of several individuals last year.
meanings.sent3: During the canonizations, the saints probably have a big celebration in heaven!
meanings.sent4: The canonizations of these remarkable individuals illuminate their virtuous lives.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing a canonization ceremony is a truly spiritual experience.

meanings.definition: The process of determining which books are included in the biblical canon.
meanings.sent1: Scholars study ancient texts to understand canonizations of the Bible.
meanings.sent2: The canonizations of the New Testament books were finalized in the early church.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a library where the books argue about their canonizations!
meanings.sent4: The canonizations of the Bible reflect the beliefs of early Christians.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the canonizations of scripture helps us appreciate its significance.

meanings.definition: The act of officially recognizing someone as a saint or holy person.
meanings.sent1: The canonizations of revered figures inspire devotion among the faithful.
meanings.sent2: The local church organized a canonization for the beloved nun.
meanings.sent3: At the canonizations, the saints must be proud of their good deeds!
meanings.sent4: The canonizations of these individuals highlight their exceptional piety.
meanings.sent5: Attending a canonization ceremony is a profound spiritual moment.
